page.title: 14CHURCH OF S.S. MARY & PETER
page.content: The Parish Church stands on site of earlier building and opened in 1864.It features High Victorian Leaf carving & built into Vestry wall is stone coffin found at the Grange in 19thC contain_ _ing sword 6 spurs. Church is part of Binbrook Group of 6 Parishes covered by one Incumbent. Sunday morning Mass averages a dozen souls but larger con_ _gregations for Harvest Festival, Christmas &c and for annual 101 Sqdn. R.A.F. Reunion. Average of 2 weddings, 2 funerals & 2 Baptisms a year but in 1985 an unprecedented 4 Baptisms on one day. No Sunday School but Rector visits school weekly and future could depend on this as most of congregation in over 50 age group. Loyal volunteers ensure upkeep of Fabric, Funds, and Churchyard. Methodist Church in village (outside this Grid) has same problems.
